result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew John ROSTOLLAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).
  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Under the Huber Law.
Two (2) months jail is imposed up front with a report date of 07-07-15 at 8:00 a.m.
The remaining four (4) months jail is stayed and will be imposed upon order of the court.
The Court authorizes transfer to either Sheboygan or Milwaukee County Jail and has no objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is to continue with his mental health treatment and take all medications as prescribed.

Undergo any other counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.

Letter from Atty. Dewane to JLF.
Plea hearing reset for 06-03-15 at 9:15 a.m.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 03-31-15 at 9:00 a.m.   Plea date is set for 05-05-15 at 9:00 a.m.   
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of fleeing an officer.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-02-15 at 9:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $7,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he not operate a motor vehicle except for travel to employment and court.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
